title: Hemet
name: Historic Hemet Theater
address: 216 E. Florida Ave. Hemet, CA 92543, USA
directions: On the corner of Florida Avenue and North Camalita Street in the Downtown District
content: The Historic Hemet Theater was built in 1917, and opened its doors in 1921. It is one of the first buildings in Hemet to have been built with poured cement, making it fire and earthquake proof â€” a quality that came in handy when the corner building caught fire in 2011. The theater is non-profit: all proceeds go directly to restorative purposes. Their [https://www.facebook.com/HistoricHemetTheatre Facebook page] is regularly updated with current events and film showings.
